usefulItems: frying pan, plate, jug, ceramic or glass bowl, stove top
title: Asian beef salad with peanut dressing

ingredients.content: 2 sirloin steaks (approx. 400-500 g total - see Tips)
1 fresh red chilli, trimmed and cut into halves
1 red capsicum, cut into thin strips (5 mm)
2 spring onions/shallots, trimmed and cut into thin slices

preparations.content: Place oil, chilli flakes, miso paste and fish sauce into mixing bowl and blend <b>10 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a glass or ceramic bowl. Add steaks, coat in marinade and set aside. Do not clean mixing bowl.
Place ginger and chilli into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add peanut butter, soy sauce, vinegar and sugar and mix <b>10 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a jug and set aside. Do not clean mixing bowl.

Place water into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh edamame beans into it. Cook <b>10 min/100Â°C/speed 4<b>. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set aside beans to cool. Continue with recipe while beans cool.
Place carrot, capsicum, cucumber, spring onions/shallots, mint and coriander onto a plate and set aside.

Place a frying pan over high heat. Add steaks and sear for 2-3 minutes, turning once, until browned and cooked to your liking. Transfer onto a separate plate and set aside to rest.  Meanwhile, remove edamame beans from pods, discarding pods. Add beans onto plate with salad.
Thinly slice rested steak, serve drizzled with reserved Peanut dressing, then serve with salad.

hintsAndTricks: You can use any good-quality cut of steak in this recipe.
We used edamame beans in pods for this recipe.
